key_points: Crew members stranded on the Noble Globetrotter II drillship during Hurricane Ida are being evacuated.
The Category 4 hurricane battered the ship off the Louisiana coast, injuring crew members.
A crew member's spouse criticized Noble Corporation for not evacuating the crew before the hurricane.
The Noble Corporation claimed to have taken evasive actions to avoid the storm.
Images of the damaged ship led the U.S. Coast Guard to send rescue operations.
The Coast Guard was informed that the vessel was not in distress and not actively taking on water.
Noble Corporation stated that all personnel are now safe and accounted for.
Noble is facilitating transport for some crew to shore and bringing in replacement personnel.
The vessel sustained damage, including to a cofferdam, but it is said not to compromise stability or safety.
Noble Corporation is locating and planning to recover sunk equipment and believes it can replace any missing or damaged equipment.
